title: Alan Rhodes (rugby league)
text:
Alan Rhodes (born ) is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s, and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>ed in the 1980s. He played at club level for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 482</a>), <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 566</a>), <a href="York%20Wasps">York</a> (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> (Heritage № 454), and the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s, and coached at club level for <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a>, and the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a>.
Background.
Alan Rhodes was a pupil at <a href="Castleford%20Academy">Castleford Grammar School</a> during the 1960s, he was in the same school year as the rugby league footballer; <a href="Roger%20Millward">Roger Millward</a>.
Playing career.
Alan Rhodes signed for Featherstone Rovers on Thursday 30 November 1967, he made his début for Featherstone Rovers on Saturday 2 March 1968, he played his last match for Featherstone Rovers during the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1974–75 season</a>, he made his début for York on Sunday 7 September 1975, and he played his last match for York on Sunday 20 April 1980, he appears to have scored no drop-goals (or field-goals as they are currently known in Australasia), but prior to the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1974–75 season</a> all goals, whether; <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">conversion</a>s, <a href="Penalty%20%28rugby%29%23Penalties%20in%20rugby%20league">penalties</a>, or <a href="Drop%20goal%23Rugby%20league">drop-goal</a>s, scored 2-points, consequently prior to this date drop-goals were often not explicitly documented, therefore '0' drop-goals may indicate drop-goals not recorded, rather than no drop-goals scored.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Alan Rhodes played left-, i.e. number 11, (replaced by <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> № 15 <a href="Barry%20Hollis">Barry Hollis</a>) in <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 33-14 victory over <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> in the <a href="1973%20Challenge%20Cup">1973</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1972%E2%80%9373%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1972–73 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 12 May 1973, in front of a crowd of 72,395, and played left- (replaced by <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> № 14 <a href="David%20Busfield">David Busfield</a>) in the 9-24 defeat by <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1974%20Challenge%20Cup">1974</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1973%E2%80%9374%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1973–74 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 11 May 1974, in front of a crowd of 77,400.
County Cup Final appearances.
Alan Rhodes played left-, i.e. number 11, in <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 7-23 defeat by <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="1970%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1970</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1970–71 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 21 November 1970, and played left-, and was <a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a> in <a href="York%20Wasps">York</a>'s 8-18 defeat by <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> in the <a href="1978%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1978</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1978%E2%80%9379%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1978–79 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 28 October 1978, this was York's first major final since the <a href="1936%E2%80%9337%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1936–37</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final, a period of 39-years, 2017 marked 39-years since the 1978 Yorkshire County Cup Final, meaning this was York's only major final in the last 78-years.
Notable tour matches.
Alan Rhodes played in <a href="York%20Wasps">York</a>'s 2-29 defeat by <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> at <a href="Clarence%20Street">Clarence Street</a>, <a href="York">York</a> on Tuesday 14 November 1978, under temporary <a href="floodlight">floodlight</a>s.
